projects.title: Yum&Yum
projects.description:
Create, Save, View, and Edit your recipes -- You can do it all. Yum&Yum is a MERN (MySQL - Express - React - Node) application designed, developed, & deployed in less than two weeks by the team of 3 people utilizing Agile methodologies. The application uses MySQL -- taking advantage of 7 tables, 7 joins and 3 many to many relationships.

The front end is built in React using hooks across 8 pages utilizing 7 additional components shared with the pages. Global State enables user engagement and favorite tracking with all the recipes. Firebase is used for Storage and Authentication.
projects.learning: Using hooks global state instead of Providers.  Use global state for variables used across all pages and only pass props to one child.  As a project, learned the value of staying focused on the product and Minimum Viable Product requirements we set.

projects.title: JobKit
projects.description:
With today’s competitive job market, many applicants need to apply an ever-increasing number of roles to ultimately land the position they want. This process can be arduous over the course of several months, so applicants often lose track of useful information related to a job. JobKit organizes all this information in one place for users to leverage and take a more active role in managing their job hunt, ensuring they follow up with the roles that interest them.

It is a Full Stack Application utilizing MySQL as the database to store the application details such as multiple contacts and stages of the application process, so users never lose information received from the recruiter and hiring company. Express-Handlebars enables the application to display the Job Opportunities and Applications effectively on the browser page.
projects.learning: Learning – Importance of tracking state while working with editable database information in modals. As a project, learned the value of LEAN projects.  Get a MVP running quickly to measure, learn and adjust where needed.

projects.title: Covid19-Tracker
projects.description:
The first coronavirus app to track the confirmed case trend for each state. The code has been maintained as API data providers changed and modularizing the software for improved readability and maintenance.

In January 2020, the World Health Organization declared the Covid-19 Virus (aka Coronavirus) represents a public health emergency of international concern. On January 31, the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services declared the virus to be a health emergency for the United States. The first recorded case in the United States was on January 22, 2020.

This application, Covid-19 Tracker is a web application that enables the user to see what is happening around the world regarding the Covid-19 Pandemic on one screen. The application enables the user to select one of the top 10 hotspots around the World and see live updates of how many cases have been Confirmed, Recovered, and Deaths associated to Covid-19 in that country. Alongside the map, the news will display the latest headline news regarding health news in that country.
projects.learning: The value of researching and utilizing established API whenever possible.  Rendering the map to display as a usable format and testing various markers to serve the needs of the software. As a project, the value of pair programming and working with project team in a virtual space.
